title: When Did Shaking Hands Become a Standard Way of Greeting Someone?
excerpt: There’s ancient evidence for the custom of shaking hands, but did it mean the same thing then as it does today?

title: Handy Mnemonics: The Five-Fingered Memory Machine
excerpt: Before humans stored memories as zeroes and ones, we turned to digital devices of another kind — preserving knowledge on the surface of fingers and palms. Kensy Cooperrider leads us through a millennium of “hand mnemonics” and the variety of techniques practised by Buddhist monks, Latin linguists, and Renaissance musicians for remembering what might otherwise elude the mind.
